ygData.subject: Re: New Question
ygData.msgSnippet: After 68 it seems we are forced to try (and fail a lot) at Skewers.   I spent around 20pp the other day to get 3 skill points on Skewers.  Kind of expensive.
ygData.messageBody:
After 68 it seems we are forced to try (and fail a lot) at Skewers. I
spent around 20pp the other day to get 3 skill points on Skewers. Kind of
expensive. I'll be glad to get away from Skewers and those dang metal bits
though. :)

DorchaLann Kilgore
Shaman of Karana


----- Original Message -----
From: Kelly <pruett@...>
To: <EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, June 18, 1999 09:39 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ_SMITHS] New Question


From: Kelly <pruett@...>

Skewers just aren't fun. I was having the same problem and just switched to
lanterns. My skill started going up frequently and I also get some return on
my
money for smithing. According to the posts I got back today, lanterns will
take
you to 68 skill so .... why not do lanterns instead of skewers until you hit
68?

By the way Grak, how was the pottery skill? I heard a master potter telling
me
he was quite profitable now and had been since about 75 in skill or so.

-Rosmorte


Software hound wrote:

> From: Software hound <softwarehound@...>
>
> I have found that it took me at least 10 skewers to get 1 point of skill.
> One time I went through 3 backpacks of skewers and did not get one point.
> Then on my next run I got 3 points in 3 tries =) I am a master in 3 trade
> skill now, and smithing is by FAR the hardest to get up. If I had to make
a
> choice I would not learn to smith again.
>
> Grak The Troll
